messages.content:
Perfect! Now I can see the data. Let me analyze the question: "How many times did Keston Bledman win a gold medal in an event, followed by any other medal in the same event?"

Looking at the data ordered by event and year:
- **100 m**: Bronze (2005), Gold (2007), Gold (2011) - After the first Gold (2007), he got another Gold (2011), but no "other" medal. After Gold (2007), Gold (2011) is not "another" type of medal.
- **4x100 m relay**: Gold (2008), Gold (2008), Gold (2009), Silver (2011), Silver (2012), Bronze (2014), Bronze (2015), Silver (2019)
  - After Gold (2008), he got Gold (2008) - same year, different tournament
  - After Gold (2008), he got Gold (2009) - same gold
  - After Gold (2009), he got Silver (2011) - this counts! ✓
- **Medley relay**: Silver (2005) - only one medal

So I need to find cases where:
1. Keston won a Gold medal in an event (specific event name) in year Y
2. Then won any other medal (non-Gold) in the same event in a later year

Let me write a query to identify this pattern:

function.arguments:
{"command": "cat <<'EOF' > /tmp/test_query.sql
SELECT 
    gold.event_name,
    gold.year as gold_year,
    other.medal_type as following_medal,
    other.year as following_year
FROM (
    SELECT f.name as event_name, m.year, m.type as medal_type
    FROM tournament t
    JOIN format f ON t.tournament_id = f.tournament_id
    JOIN medal m ON f.format_id = m.format_id
    WHERE t.athlete_id = 1 AND m.type = 'MedalGold'
) gold
JOIN (
    SELECT f.name as event_name, m.year, m.type as medal_type
    FROM tournament t
    JOIN format f ON t.tournament_id = f.tournament_id
    JOIN medal m ON f.format_id = m.format_id
    WHERE t.athlete_id = 1 AND m.type != 'MedalGold'
) other
ON gold.event_name = other.event_name AND gold.year < other.year;
EOF
psql -f /tmp/test_query.sql"}

    JOIN medal m ON f.format_id = m.format_id

EOF
psql -f /tmp/test_query.sql
